data.headline: Nasdaq 100 futures drop about 1.0%, S&P 500 down 0.6%, Dow and Russell 2000 each off 0.4% in quiet, post-holiday premarket trade
bullets: Tech sector under pressure as AI disruption fears, job-market worries, and fresh competition from Alibaba’s Qwen 3.5 weigh on sentiment
Chip stocks, including Nvidia, extend declines, dragging broader tech and software names lower
Big Tech CapEx concerns spill over into logistics, financials, real estate, and other non-tech sectors
S&P 500 faces back-to-back weekly losses, while Nasdaq heads for a five-week losing streak after its sharpest pullback since November
Traders eye a thin but pivotal data docket this week, including Empire State manufacturing, NAHB housing, Fed minutes, jobs data, Q4 GDP, and Friday’s PCE
Earnings slate features Walmart, DoorDash, Palo Alto Networks, Medtronic, Energy Transfer, and Vulcan Materials
Premarket movers: Fiserv rises on Jana Partners stake, Danaher falls on Masimo deal reports, ZIM up on Hapag-Lloyd merger talk, Norwegian Cruise Line gains on Elliott stake
Renewed Warner Bros. Discovery–Paramount talks and Blackstone’s pursuit of Champions Group fuel media and private-equity M&A hopes
